quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Vitamin and Skin
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, chemical, sweat. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many types of skin are there depending on skins reaction to UV-radiation?
Mammary glands are considered to be modified sweat glands.
What is the name of the chemical compound that stands behind vitamin C?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: L-ascorbic acid

questions.question: Vitamin C is a powerful antioxidant and pro-oxidant.
The skin has its own ecosystems of microorganisms, including yeasts and bacteria, which cannot be removed by washing.
Skin consists of how many basic layers?
The epidermis is very rich in blood vessels.
Which of these animals has lost the ability to synthesize vitamin C?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Vitamin C is necessary for the production of this protein in the human body.
What is the average number of sweat glands in the skin per square inch (6.5cm²)?
Most animals and plants are not able to synthesize vitamin C by themselves.
What is the natural oil produced by human skin called?
The deficiency of vitamin C leads to this disease, which can be lethal.
Vitamin C is said to be beneficial for the treatment of various diseases and medical conditions. Which of the following is one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the quantity of vitamin C that a healthy adult goat produces daily?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13 grams or more

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Vitamin and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, diseases, chemical. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the B vitamins is also known as folic acid?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B9

questions.question: What fruit is believed to be the highest in vitamin C content?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kakadu plum

questions.question: In the US, Medicare Part B is primarily coverage for which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Non-hospital services

questions.question: In the US, to qualify for Medicare benefits, you must meet be which of the following?

options.text: Be over 65 OR be disabled OR getting dialysis OR have ALS (Lou Gehrigs Disease)
Be over 70 OR have MS (multiple sclerosis) OR be blind OR have ALS (Lou Gehrigs Disease)
Be over 60 OR be disabled OR getting dialysis OR have ALS (Lou Gehrigs Disease)
Be over 60 OR have MS (multiple sclerosis) OR be blind OR have ALS (Lou Gehrigs Disease)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Be over 65 OR be disabled OR getting dialysis OR have ALS (Lou Gehrigs Disease)

questions.question: Vitamin E is naturally soluble in this substance.
The deficiency of what vitamin causes Rickets and Osteomalacia in humans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin D

questions.question: Which of the B vitamins is known as thiamine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B1

questions.question: In what substance is vitamin K soluble?
Who administers the US health program Medicaid, and who funds Medicaid?

options.text: Medicaid is administered by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), and funded by the state governments.
Medicaid is administered by each state government, and is funded by the federal government.
Medicaid is administered by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), and jointly funded by the Federal Government and the state governments.
Medicaid is administered by each state government, and is jointly funded by the federal government and the state governments.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Medicaid is administered by each state government, and is jointly funded by the federal government and the state governments.

questions.question: What food is a rich source of vitamin B6?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The highest concentration of vitamin C in animals bodies is in their liver. Which of these animals has the largest quantity of vitamin C in its liver?
An overdose of what vitamin can cause diarrhea, nausea and heartburn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B5

questions.question: Which of these diseases is associated with vitamin A deficiency?
What chemical compound is commonly known as vitamin C?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ascorbic acid

questions.question: Niacin is the name of this B vitamin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B3

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Body and Medicare
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, premium, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the name of the iris flower literally mean in Greek?
Narcissus plants, commonly called daffodils, contain the toxin lycorine in which structure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulb and leaves

questions.question: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) used to be known as what?

options.text: The Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Health Care Financing Administration (HCFA)

questions.question: If an orbiting body is revolving around its parent body in a perfectly circular path at a distance of 1,000,000,000 kilometers with an orbital velocity of 15 km/s, how long is its year in Earth years?
What does the poppy flower symbolize in many cultures as well as in art?
A US citizen can qualify for both Medicare and Medicaid at the same time.
In the US, all Medicare Part B participants pay a monthly premium for the service.
In the US, all Medicare Part A participants pay a premium for the service.
Which of the following 4 people is most likely to be eligible for the US health program Medicaid?

options.text: A 25-year-old single man who is unemployed
A 25-year-old self-employed married man with 5 children
A 25-year-old single woman who is pregnant and unemployed

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A 25-year-old single woman who is pregnant and unemployed

questions.question: With regard to Medicare Part D, what is the donut hole?

options.text: The donut hole is the coverage gap for patients who eat donuts.
The donut hole is the coverage gap for patients between Medicaid age and Medicare age.
The donut hole is the coverage gap during which the patient is responsible for all drug costs.
The donut hole is the loss of health insurance to patients whose diets are unhealthy.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The donut hole is the coverage gap during which the patient is responsible for all drug costs.

questions.question: If a mass of 1 kilogram has a gravitational force of approximately 6.8x10^-12 at 1 meter (Earth = 1), what would the surface gravitational force be on a body with a mass of 5x10^18 kilograms and a diameter of 100 kilometers?
If the planet Mars, with a diameter of 6772 kilometers, is at a distance of 80,000,000 kilometers, what is its angular diameter in arc seconds?
What type of structure do tulips grow out from?

A body is orbiting another body in an elliptical orbit with a closest approach of 1000 kilometers and a farthest approach of 2000 kilometers. At its farthest approach, a triangle formed by connecting its orbital positions one day apart to its parent body covers an area of 100,000 square kilometers. How large of an area does this body sweep out in the period of one day at its closest approach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 100,000 square kilometers

questions.question: The State Childrens Health Insurance Program (SCHIP) was primarily designed to do what?

options.text: Provide additional health insurance to children who are receiving Medicaid
Provide health insurance to disabled children
Provide health insurance to older children
Provide health insurance to children who do not qualify for Medicaid

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Provide health insurance to children who do not qualify for Medicaid

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Animals and Species
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, birds, ears. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The carnation is the national flower of this European country.
According to Greek mythology, Zeus saved one of Asclepius students from his wrath by turning him into this flower.
Viola plants, commonly referred to as violets, pansies or heartsease, are used as food and in medicine because they are rich in these nutrients.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamins A and C

questions.question: Three of these species shed their skin. Which one does not?
All of these animals have large ears (relative to their size) except one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polar bears

questions.question: Snakes are this kind of animals.
Three of these animals hibernate. Which one does not?
To which continent are common daisies native?
This percentage of all snakes on Earth are lethal to humans.
These are typical Australian animals except one.
Three of these Latin names are names of bears. Which is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Felis silvestris catus

questions.question: The Lilium plants, commonly known as lilies, are extremely toxic to this animal.
All of these animals are omnivorous except one.
All dogs, cats and birds are colorblind.
Representatives of three of these species produce venom of their own. Which is the odd species?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Snakes and Cobras
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, snakes, nixon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The King Cobra feeds almost exclusively on other snakes, even toxic ones.
A baby cobra is fully able to defend itself in as little as this many hours after being born.
A specialist in snakes is called one of these.
What type of dog did Richard Nixon receive from a Texan while he was a candidate for Vice President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cocker Spaniel

questions.question: Snakes are very likely to attack us, regardless of whether they feel threatened or not.
Snakes belong to the following category.
Snakes consume their food by means of this process.
Snakes reproduce only by laying eggs.
This is where the Cobras ribs are situated.

options.text: In its chest, around the middle of the body

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Behind its head

questions.question: Cobras are venomous snakes of family Elapidae, that generally inhabit regions of these two continents.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asia and Africa

questions.question: Snake skin is covered in scales.
The Cobra is at the top of the food chain, with only two main predators -- one is man and the other is this animal.
The cobras most recognizable feature is its hood, a flap of skin and muscle behind the head, believed to serve this purpose.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: More threatening appearance

questions.question: Snakes are deaf.
One of the following snakes does not belong to the Viperidae family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grass snake

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Species and Breed
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, breed, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of Fraisers fathers dog on the hit TV show set in Seattle?
Jack jumper ants, yellowish-orange carnivorous ants named after their characteristic jumpy motions, can be found only on which continent?
This small nocturnal animal, whose natural habitat are the deserts of Northern Africa, is known to jump not only for hunting or protection, but also for pleasure.
What breed is known as the favourite breed of Queen Elizabeth II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Welsh Corgi

questions.question: Which of these Presidents had the most pets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodore Roosevelt

questions.question: The endangered Komodo dragon is the largest living lizard in the world, growing to an average length of 2-3 meters (10 feet).
This freshwater mammal, found only in the Yangtze River, is the most endangered (even possibly extinct) cetacean and one of the most endangered species in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chinese River Dolphin

questions.question: This species of great apes with long arms and reddish hair suffer habitat destruction due to logging, mining and forest fires.
Name the rarest and most endangered of all wolves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Wolf

questions.question: This endangered turtle is the biggest of all living turtles, reaching a length of over 2.7 m (8.8 ft) and weight of 900 kg (2,000 lb).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leatherback Sea Turtle

questions.question: Which one of these sea mammals is not in the endangered species lists?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pilot whale

questions.question: President Fords dog was named Freedom.
What was the name of Socks companion at the White House during the Clinton Administration?
What is the natural habitat of the snows leopard, that was hunted down for its beautiful fur, as a result of which its population went down to 1,000 animals in the 1960s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Central Asia

questions.question: The Asian Elephant, the only living species of the genus Elephas, is the bigger relative of the African Elephant.
